pageContext.claim: “We won easily -- we won that easily, 306 to -- I think it was 223. We won it easily. That was a great victory. That was a great day for this country.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump earned 306 pledged electors, Clinton 232. Trump always seems to reduce Clinton's number. According to a tally by John Pitney of Claremont McKenna College, every Republican president since Rutherford B. Hayes in 1876 won a larger share of the electoral college votes than Trump, with the exception of George W. Bush (twice) and Nixon in 1968.
